intro: Chaenorhinum flexuosum, commonly known as the flexible horned poppy, is an annual herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features slender, branching stems that often lie prostrate or are slightly ascending. The plant produces striking, showy flowers with bright orange or red petals and prominent, horn-like structures at the base. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
